column4: hi folks, I'm really enjoying 10.04 (will be upgrading next month when I got more bandwidth). So a few months ago I tried to install to my laptop and it stopped about 90-95%. I installed on another computer, it worked fine. Thing is, I have this in the laptop working now, but as the desktop had an nvidia card, and this has some laptop thing (I think it's SIS) I can't get more than 800x600 in the monitor adjustment program. Is th
ere a way I can up it to 1280x800, which I think is the maximum res on a fujitsu v5535? Sound, wireless, keyboard and trackpad all work fine btw!

True, but at least it works, and as the most strenious thing I want to do on this is watch a few movies that should be alright. I don't see how the nvidia drivers will fix the issue, as this laptop doesn't have an nvidia graphics chip.
you can try creating your own xorg
